critique: The document discusses placing special agents employed in collecting cotton statistics into the competitive classified service. This action could be seen as a move towards standardization and away from special treatment, but it doesn't strongly align with any particular political ideology. The emphasis on competitive examinations suggests a merit-based approach, which could be seen as neutral in terms of social inclusion. The exclusion from the Retirement Act due to the intermittent character of the employment suggests a practical consideration rather than a political stance.
